questions.question: Which of the following represents the acronym STEAL?

choices.answer: Speech, Teach, Effects on Others, Actions, Links
Speech, Thoughts, Effects on Others, Actions, Looks
Space, Time, Examples, Aliens, Lines
Speech, Thoughts, Evidence, Lies

questions.question: In which of the following quotes is the author trying to evoke a sense of time and place?

choices.answer: “Nah, man get away. You got the cooties”
“Not my man Nazario. He’s my brothuh, we share the same vision”
“Why not Sapo? Why not have him work with Nazario?”
“some men...set up a table & were sitting on milk crates playing dominoes"

questions.question: Who is the author of Bodega Dreams?

choices.answer: Ernesto Quiñonez
Willie Bodega
Pedro Pietri
F. Scott Fitzgerald

questions.question: “Bodega wanted something from me, so I would ask something in return.” What will Chino ask of Bodega?

choices.answer: Chino never says this, he wants nothing to do with Bodega.
Chino will ask Bodega to leave Chino’s family alone.
Chino will ask Bodega for a bigger and cheaper apartment.
Chino will ask for a minivan to accommodate his growing family.

questions.question: Which quote reveals Sapo’s response to Chino after Chino refuses Bodega's offer?

choices.answer: “Nah, man get away. You got the cooties”
“Yo bro, I’m so glad, you said no to Bodega. He’s dangerous”
“B*llsh*t. This guy is talking a lot of dreams, bro. Clouds”
“Mira, Chino, you need somethin’, anythin’, come see me”

questions.question: How does an author reveal the personality of a character using direct and indirect characterization?

choices.answer: Direct characterization shows; Indirect characterization tells
The author just describes the character’s personality using vivid details.
Direct characterization tells; Indirect characterization shows
Indirect and direct characterization both show the reader.

questions.question: "in his forties with a goatee and droopy eyes of an ex-heroin addict. His hair was curly...he was about five feet ten"

choices.answer: This quote describes Chino.
This quote describes Bodega.
This quote describes Joe Kennedy.
This quote describes Nazrio.
Vera is Negra's mother.
Vera is Blanca's aunt.
Vera is Chino's ex-girlfriend.
Vera is Sapo's long, lost love
